title: What is
first_phrase: This text explores the topic of non-verbal communication and the power it holds to influence others. The previous section covered the basics of non-verbal communication, including proxemics, paralinguistics, gaze, magnetic passes, and gestures. The last part of the text delves deeper into the topic, introducing the concept of non-verbal hypnotism, the closure of the senses technique, and the 10 plexuses technique. It also includes exercises aimed at discovering the power of proxemics and understanding basic principles, such as the magnetic circle and the magnetic ecstasy technique. Readers will learn how to heal pain in the spine and combat anxiety, as well as the benefits of inducing a state of ecstasy and how it can be used in therapy.

last_phrase: In conclusion, non-verbal hypnosis can be a powerful tool for therapeutic interventions, but it requires expertise and sensitivity to individual differences. It involves a combination of approaches, including symbolic and accompanying, proxemics, touch, and sound, to elicit emotional responses and facilitate a state of trance. Understanding the neurological and psychological interpretations of the work on the two sides of the individual, as well as the use of feedback loops and testing, can enhance the effectiveness of non-verbal hypnosis. Finally, the use of fluidification and magnetism can further enhance the client's receptivity to hypnosis and achieve balancing and healing effects.
